dialogues.text: Another city doesn't seem unattractive to Madolyn, who's her own cut-and-run crisis -- but maybe she can't believe that Colin is thinking about it. She blows a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another city? It'd be a clean slate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN is in hell.    He looks at her intensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to know you don't gotta stay. If we're not going to make it, it's got to be you that gets out. I'm not capable (a beat) I'm fuckin' Irish, so I'll deal with something being wrong for the rest of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad idea, another city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FITZY and DELAHUNT are smoking on the sidewalk outside th restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I know how to spot a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, how's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's not paying attention to us, he's a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN across the street is looking into the window of an antique shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that guy over there, he's a cop. He's not paying attention to us. He's a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lot of fucking cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN walks by definitely ignoring both men, dragging a lapdog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of dog is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's probably the fucking Police Commissioner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too early to be opened for business. COSTELLO and NEW GUY six hard customers, come in through the fire door. At the BAR, BILLY is drinking coffee. He notices the NEW GUYS. O the boat Dublin toughs. COSTELLO and FRENCH come in from kitchen. FRENCH tells the NEW GUYS to move to the back. COSTELLO HAS BLOOD ON HIS SLEEVES. He comes over to the b and looks at BILLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can get out of here.   This is the crew for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was on for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I changed my mind. Take the night off. (to Bartender) Jimmy, get the mop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSTELLO heads to the back of the restaurant. MISTER FREN grabs the BAR KNIFE from behind the bar. BILLY looks up a him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go out the back. Some guys answer the questions right. Some don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MISTER FRENCH goes towards the back of the restaurant, holding the big knife. BILLY closes his paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY steps out, ignoring DELAHUNT and FITZY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're ignoring us. You're a cop. We're guessing who cops are. Most good looking women are cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. I'm going home. He's playing with his new boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY walks down the street and heads into an alley.   Ar the corner, he opens his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's moving something with all new guys. (A whole new crew.) I don't want to tell you what or where. It might be disinformation. It probably is. Just keep following him. I need to see you today. (a beat...reacting to Queenan, Billy continues) No. Today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DETECTIVE (DETECTIVE 1) is leading the team to trail af Queenan. On foot. A plug in his ear. Two other DETECTIVES in a sedan nearby. (These three detectives are new guys, never seen before, the I.I. surveillance team working for Colin).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask a question, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the fuck are we following Captain Queenan? To find out about the good Catholic life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily) I have to follow every lead, however unlikely, however fucking painful it might be to your delicate fucking sensibilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says I have delicate sensibilities?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have reason to believe that Queenan is Costello's informer. Follow him, and don't get made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that, Sarge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detectives in the car get alert and start their car a QUEENAN comes out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarge, we got the target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DETECTIVE 1 trails Captain Queenan through the crowds of people heading towards work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUEENAN begins to light a cigarette and then gives it up. TRAIN comes in, and Queenan boards. DETECTIVE 1 boards th next car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking through smeared glass into the next car as the tr begins to move DETECTIVE 1 sees QUEENAN answer a cell cal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUEENAN is on his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look down the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUEENAN looks up mildly as the car rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY is slumped in a seat at the far end, not looking towards QUEENAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any reason you'd have a tail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the verge of hyperventilating) I'm watching a guy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a tail, Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the glass we see DETECTIVE 1 watching Queenan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Get off at South Station. You wait there for ten minutes. After I leave I'll text message you the address where we'll meet. I'll make sure you don't have a tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: South Station. Wait ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the train stops BILLY vaults off of it. On the platfor walks along, texting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUEENAN, mild in his specs, chewing gum with his dentures comes out of the station, and looks at the TEXT MESSAGE o his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A building under rehab, covered with scaffolding, but sti functioning as a corporate building. QUEENAN goes along t the entrance, and in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DETECTIVE 1 comes along after him. We see the Internal Investigations car up the street. DETECTIVE 1 dials his cellphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went into a building on the waterfront. Address is 344 Wash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DETECTIVE 1 looks at the elevator-indicator, and the buil directory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went to the top floor. It's empty. No tenants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN, listening, playing with a COIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DETECTIVE 1 emerges from the building and joins other detectives in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what we're doing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN, after fumbling between cell phones, dials the corr one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to COSTELLO) I think I've got him. I think Queenan is meeting with him right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FITZY and DELAHUNT'S phones ring simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the van. Get the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY is waiting on the roof as QUEENAN finally arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assume these premises do not have an anti-smoking ordinance. So, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, he's got dope coming in, I don't know where. He's getting spooky, Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's crazy. I just saw the man. He had blood all over him. I can't get any more information for you. I can't trust it. He's not including his regular guys... I'm telling you, he's gonna find out who I am. He's gonna fuckin' kill me, I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right. I hear you. I'm sorry for you trouble. Look, I'm not gonna jeopardize your safety any longer. I'll get you out. I can't do it overnight but I'll do it. We can bust him for what we have. At least I think we can...I hope. You're out of there ASAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY nods, and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?   What about the FBI?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're compromised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fucked, just like this lighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY'S phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELAHUNT is calling Billy from a van crowded with Costell usual bad guys as it scorches through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, where the fuck are you? We been trying to reach you. We found the rat. Top man says we're gonna take care of him. The address is 314 Washington Street. You got it? All right. See you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY listens in horror, staring at the oblivious QUEENAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were fucking followed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costello's people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. One of the cops he's got inside tipped him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUEENAN realizes that his enemy might be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN raises his eyes. Diabolical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FITZY'S VAN stops outside the building. COSTELLO'S MEN ge out of the van, and head into the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DETECTIVES are watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy fucking shit. Looks like Queenan's meeting with all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy and Queenan are running downstairs when they hear footsteps coming up from below. They immediately go back to the elevator lobby. Pushing through plastic sheeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy is slamming elevator buttons. The indicator shows b elevators coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be on the elevators, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the back fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be fine. If you get made I can't protect you. Go down the fire escape. Now. That's an order. I'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY goes. Queenan waits. Watching the elevator indicato QUEENAN, in his specs, very mild, takes out his gun and breaks the cylinder, checking that it is loaded, and putt a shell into the empty sixth chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY climbs out onto the fire escape at the back of the building and starts dropping down, fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door opens, revealing DELAHUNT and BOYS. QUE looks right as the door to the staircase opens revealing FITZY and boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you gentlemen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we've had enough of this shit. Where's your boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUEENAN doesn't answer, and never will. He draws his gun is tackled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY drops off the fire escape and runs down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY towards the front doors just as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUEENAN'S BODY bounces off the scaffolding, smashes into pavement and explodes. BLOOD splashes all over BILLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DETECTIVE 1 screams into his headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!   Something came off the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What came off the roof? What do you mean something came off the roof? Go again with that information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FITZY, DELAHUNT and boys come out. The crew has seen the UNMARKED COP CAR. FITZY grabs BILLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fuckin' late. Where the fuck were you? Get in the fuckin' van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened?    I came to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start piling into a van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DETECTIVE 2 is yelling both at his partner and into the m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay in the fucking car. Stay in the fucking car. This is a surveillance unit. (into mic to Colin) Do I pursue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN is sitting very calmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Stay where you are. I need some fucking information here. What came off the building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No pursuit. No pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DETECTIVE 1 gets out of the car and runs towards the flee men, gun drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FITZY turns on DETECTIVE 1 with a pistol drawn. DETECTIVE fires and DELAHUNT is hit in the stomach. FITZY shoots th detective (he is wounded in the hand, not killed). The VA takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-two X to CP. Thirty-two X to CP. We're being fired upon. I repeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON RADIO. "Officer down", etc. COLIN has never felt more guilty in his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have an officer down. An officer has been shot. Request immediate assistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He switches off the light and sits in the dark as the afternoon gathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FITZY, BILLY, and the BOYS are drinking. Dirty, paranoid, guilty, frightened, smoking. DELAHUNT has been shot, is dying, on a dirty couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FITZY sits down and looks at Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where the fuck were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss told me to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he did and maybe he didn't. At any rate you weren't fuckin' home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in a fucking grocery store with no signal. When I got a signal I got the call. What the fuck do you want. Was I there or was I not there? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FITZY walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy. Billy (Billy goes over to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: his wounds) Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two days...two days ago the Boss says to me, it's been ten years already, and you've never done me wrong. He asked me, if one of the other guys is a rat, would I take him out. I told him I would but I don't know if I would. Now I know I can't. I've done a lot of bad things but I've never been a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY realizes that DELAHUNT is dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Billy, I don't want no one to put me in a dumpster. Just don't put me in a dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're dead it makes no difference where they put you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY lights him a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I thought today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who didn't show up today is the rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never been late in your life. And when I called you... I made a mistake. I gave you the wrong address. But you showed up at the right one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELAHUNT grips his arm. BILLY is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me why I didn't say anything. Tell me why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits for DELAHUNT to continue. But DELAHUNT after an smile of complicity, finally dies. BILLY, the only one wh knows that DELAHUNT is dead, stares down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drinking) That cop was tough. We were excessive with the cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY walks past the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead. I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY leaves by the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hands present. Dignam is in a black silent rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know why Queenan went to that building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A better question is why your fuckers were following him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Internal Investigations to follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's internal Investigations business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIGNAM grabs COLIN by the neck and runs him into a wall. COLIN gets a palm under Dignam's chin and comes close to breaking his neck. The men at length are separated. COLIN straightens his good clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to investigate everybody and anybody. I don't have to justify anything. Nor does anyone have to like it. I now have information...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from a very good source...that Queenan may have been killed by his own undercover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN is trying this on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a fucking lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Queenan and Staff Sergeant Dignam here have information on this undercover, and other informants, in a locked file. I need those files unlocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have the password.   Why don't you come down to the garage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIGNAM hits COLIN in the face. COLIN goes down hard, into crook of a file cabinet and the wall. Blood from his mout

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one calls me a liar. Especially when I'm lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody shut up. (to BROWN) Work with the tech guys to unlock the files. Dignam. You take a leave of absence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queenan's dead. That makes me your boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll hand in my papers first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, world needs plenty of bartenders. Two weeks with pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need those codes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you want those codes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she comes out: BILLY is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to call you a few times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.     (I know.).   I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans close to her.    She strokes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't be a friend to you. I can't. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, okay, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MADOLYN walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN needs a shower and is gun-shy as people move past t glass windows. He is still rinsing blood out of his mouth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSTELLO is listening to LUCIA di LAMMAMOOR. GWEN sits ne in attractive lingerie, reading a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, when I hear Lucia, I can't stop thinking about the cocaine curtsy you did on that nigger broad's face. (the phone rings. Costello answers:) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Your shouldn't have killed Queenan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of us was going to have to die. With me it tends to be the other guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agitated) You're crazy, Frank. You killed the guy who has all the information. And Dignam's not in the office, he's gone. He resigned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a fuck about Dignam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fucking gone. They took his papers in. He's not talking. I don't know where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get your balls in an uproar, Collie. That Irish piss-ant won't be a problem. He's so hot for me, we give him a whiff of my ass, he'll crawl right in it. Let's give him a whiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSTELLO turns to the GWEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart, you're giving me a hard- on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to dial the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure it's me or all that talk about whiffin' and crawlin' up asses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, watch your fucking mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises and as she crosses:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me straighten you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN looks out into the bullpen. People working. On a ta he sees PLASTIC BAGS which contains Queenan's bloodstaine effects-- broken glasses, smashed wristwatch, and CELLPHO He glances around, and picks up the CELLPHONE. Blood gets his fingers. He moves into the office, and seen through t glass, he seizes the phone and with trembling fingers pun up the last incoming number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY is looking at a chipped SANTA MUG from his childhoo and is eating something--sheer maintenance, and drinking from the bottle. His phone rings. He looks at the ID and stunned. Queenan's number! He picks up the call but remai silent. The caller is also doing the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN hears that the other side has hung up the phone. He sees: ELLERBY looking at him through the glass. But Eller hasn't seen the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY is agitated. Exhausted. Frightened. He paces, and l at the phone. He begins to pack, assembling clothes, mone Finally, like a man committing suicide--it's that intense he dials the number. INTERCUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You called this number on a dead guy's phone. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it is you. Thank God you're all right. We were very worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking to Sergeant Sullivan. I'm taking over Queenan's unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to Dignam to confirm it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staff Sgt. Dignam has... taken a leave of absence. He's very upset. We're all very upset. The best thing would be for your to come in. We need you to come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY listens to Colin go on. Then shuts off the phone. H other phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN dumps out the box of Queenan's belongings. In the diary he sees an entry showing undercover suspects Costel is FBI informant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY listens to Colin go on. Then shuts off the phone. H other phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSTELLO is sitting with his key guys, including FRENCH a FITZY. A TV station plays above the zinc bar. BILLY is drinking, hitting it heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: State Police have confirmed that the body of the man found dead in the Fenway marshes yesterday afternoon is that of Timothy Delahunt, an undercover policeman for the City of Boston.. This was the scene today.... If you have any information about this murder, you are urged to call the Boston Police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV shows DELAHUNT'S BODY being loaded into an ambulan A crime scene. COSTELLO's eyes have widened slightly. But is strangely undisturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.   I can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't believe what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm embarrassed. How the fuck did they find him so fast? I spent all fuckin' night out there, dragged the poor bastard.... I must have been there seven hours. In three feet of mud. What the fuck is a marsh? And who walks their dog in a fuckin' marsh? In three feet of water? I don't believe it. I still don't believe he's a fuckin' cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops are saying he's a cop so I won't look for the cop. (to FITZY) Are you soft? The next time I tell you to dump a body in the marshes, put it in the fuckin' marshes, not where some guy from John Hancock goes every Thursday to get a blowjob!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes a move for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get up to leave, following him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cars carrying Costello and his men are speeding down highway. Behind them, two SIU CARS are trailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN closes his door and punches in a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN COSTELLO'S CAR, his cell phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go. You've got a tail. Two cars. Not very subtle. They won't be subtle from now on. That's what I've been trying to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no need to go yourself, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of the fuckin' tail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on COLIN as what he has to do crystallizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.   All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cold look in his eye, Colin leaves his office and goes the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costello remarks to French --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tails. Fuckin' rats. This rat shit is wearing me thin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francis, they're all rats. Women are rats... cunts...Yeah, we're becoming a nation of rats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BROWN is there. BARRIGAN. ELLERBY. Others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. Stop. Pull these guys off. Tell your team to stop following Costello. We don't need to surveil him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN stands in the door like a gunfighter. Everyone look him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have it from an undercover: Costello knows he's being followed. Let our UC take him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What informant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Queenan's guy. He called me when he found out Queenan was dead. I'm running him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   You give him to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But I can give you Costello's destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where he's going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And what he's about to do. Call off the tail, and get Special Ops. Get them on standby. We meet him where he's going. Suit up. We're gonna take this prick tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to crew on the road) All units fall back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone moves at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSTELLO is checking the rearview mirror. He sees: The TW SIU CARS exit the highway onto Atlantic Avenue. COSTELLO smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars exit the highway. The cars pass through a maze o industrial streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY, riding in the back seat, is trying desperately to where they are. He sees a STREET SIGN and taps out a text message on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN, in vest, observed by Brown, reads the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the heavy equipment warehouse Costello owns on Sheffield. He must have a container or a truck in there. (his big moment of decision) Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is an unfinished structure, the lower parts used, the upper parts accessible but still under construction. It i built on a pier, the harbor lights beyond it. The COMMAND and POLICE CARS pull up with lights off. A TACTICAL VAN disgorges TACTICAL OFFICERS who spread out through the da

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic) There's an exit on the other side. Cover it. We'll take him when he comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN checks the load on his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSTELLO unlocks a CONTAINER with a construction company on it, opens the doors, and steps back. BILLY looks into container. It's cocaine or heroin in kilo bricks. Men sta around with MP5s under their coats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Load it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY, trying to save Costello...

dialogues.text: How do you know you don't have a tail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSTELLO looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you in the fuckin' car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they took one off and put another one on, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Load.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drugs having been loaded fast by the crew, including FNG's, the container is hosed out. BILLY turns from FITZY CAR as everyone gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank told me to check out the back. You guys go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of getting into COSTELLO'S CAR on the other side the container, he steps back into shadows as both cars le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cocksucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIGHTS come on, and Policemen are everywhere, guns in the hands. COLIN is not visible among them.

dialogues.text: POLICE open fire at Costello's car. THE CAR reverses back into the garage. MISTER FRENCH (the driver) is shot in th arm, and the car crashes into a wall. A gunfight opens up FNG's exchange fire with brutally efficient tactical cops are shot down expertly. COSTELLO, limping, gets out of th action, fast. He runs into the parking garage. French dri away (alternately is shot, or commits suicide).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSTELLO, shot through the stomach, is moving through the dark. All that's stored in this garage is heavy equipment the big dig. Plenty of places to hide. We hear gunfire in distance. COSTELLO hides between two pieces of heavy equipment and dials his telephone. To his surprise the ph rings quite nearby. And keeps ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSTELLO moves out into the open, and sees, at a near distance, COLIN, his shadow long on the concrete. He has gun in his hand. Costello moves out to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an FBI informant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSTELLO comes out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Colin, grow up. Course I'm talking to the FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSTELLO says nothing for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never gave up anybody who wasn't goin' down anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN instantly raises the pistol to shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you give me up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN'S PISTOL wavers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN shakes his head and cocks the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Frank, do they know about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you, Colin. You know I'd never give you up. You're like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A son...to you? Is that what it is about, all that murderin' and fuckin' and no sons? What are you, shooting blanks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSTELLO tries to raise his gun which is inside his sleev He's sitting on his coat so that the shot goes off sidewa as COLIN shoots him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSTELLO topples backward into the bucket of the bucket loader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then from the bucket loader, a post death tremor sets off last shot from COSTELLO'S gun. Ricochet. COLIN fires into dead body again and again. He backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got Costello! I got Costello here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin is debriefed concerning the shooting of Costello. [Dialog separate document].

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN enters, tired from a debriefing. Applause from ever in the office--the full crew. COLIN is embarrassed by the attention. BROWN is leading the whole team to a standing ovation. COLIN looks past the heads of the crowd and sees Dignam, staring at him evenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to crowd) It's not any reason for, ah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUEENAN'S SECRETARY brings him some wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a glass of wine. Then guiltily, almost in tears, drinks. BROWN jerks a thumb towards Colin's office #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's waited a long time for you. (COLIN looks up and sees BILLY) How'd you get him without the files?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caller ID. On Queenan's phone. You know that guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we were classmates together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Colin's office BILLY sits with his ankle on his knee. looks very tired, dirty. Wearing a VISITOR badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you Trooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   "Trooper".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin Sullivan. We spoke on the phone. How long have you been undercover?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long time.     Long fuckin' time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't begin to tell you what a debt we owe you. I want you to know I'll be recommending you for the Medal of Merit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medal of Merit. Oh, yeah. That's kinda like a gold star around here, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the highest honor we got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want my identity back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to be a cop again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, being a cop's not an identity. I want my identity back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to excuse me. My only contact has been with a police shrink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throat clicks) A police shrink. (instead of asking the obvious) Was that... helpful for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do about the rat in this building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna find him. Don't you worry about that. You got anything? Did Frank, ah, say anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all done being a cop. I just want to get my money and go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough. You've given a lot. I can get you your file. I just need your password.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The password's my name, William Costigan, Jr. They gave it to me in case something happened to them and I had to explain myself to someone like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He writes it.    Colin takes the paper and hides his astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Bill. Just give me a minute. I'm gonna go in the other room. This computer's gone blooey on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy nods.    He goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN accesses the personal database, enters the password Billy's confidential file opens up. Every fact about the Photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy takes a drink from the bottle COLIN has put on the desk. As he puts the bottle down he sees, sticking out of box, a BROWN ENVELOPE. On it is written "CITIZENS." BILLY picks up the envelope...and knows everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN is reviewing it Billy's file. Outside the glass wal see BILLY, staring at COLIN's back...and then moving on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN enters, holding a printout of Billy's personnel fil He looks around the empty room. He sees the BROWN ENVELOP lying on the desk, and understands everything. He sits do at his own computer--which does in fact work, and opens t personnel file.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN clicks DELETE. "Do You Really Want to Delete?" COLI clicks "Yes" and Billy's picture, file, life, disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY exits the police building and moves across the plaz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY waits outside Madolyn's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MADOLYN, carrying work, breakfast, rounds the corner and him standing and waiting for her. She's a little spooked, opens her mouth to speak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I'm not here to...I'm not here for that. I've got something to...to give to you...something I need you to keep. For me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping her from speaking) I need you to be my friend here and not ask any questions. That's for you to hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a manila envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only you. Open this if I'm dead or if I call you and tell you to open it. Please do exactly what it says. Exactly what it says, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madolyn is a friend. She's not going to ask questions. accepts the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to show up here like this. There was no one else I could give it to. I'm sorry. There was no one else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He backs away, and then turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...we... (he turns) I've, it's, been so confused... I just want to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and looks at her.          She doesn't speak: ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you have to say, really think about it, and if you still want to tell me, tell me in two weeks, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves her head slightly, watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MADOLYN sits at her desk, devastated, looking at a fall o light. The envelope lies on her blotter. She sits on ... then straightens up, takes a marker and writes "COSTIGAN" the envelope and puts it in her desk drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We DISSOLVE to a SONOGRAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SONOGRAM picture of a fetus. It looks to him at first l a CCTV picture blown up. COLIN stares as if at something horror film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was dreaming...

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was dreaming I was dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death is hard. Life is much easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Referring to the envelope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're joking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a joke, it's a human being.

dialogues.text: Colin belatedly thinks of what a human being might do in these circumstances and kisses her.

dialogues.text: COLIN is in the shower. MADOLYN moves into the     kitche puts the kettle on. She checks the mail, lying     there counter. It's tied with a string. She undoes       the st sorts through the mail. Suddenly, she freezes      lookin

dialogues.text: AN OVERSIZED ENVELOPE addressed to COLIN: [COLIN SULLIVAN Pickering Street, Apt TK, Boston, MA, zip TK], with a ret address of Wm. Costigan, 13 Conant St., Boston, etc., etc

dialogues.text: COLIN comes out of the bathroom, dressed in jeans and t- shirt, barefoot, his hair wet. He looks at Madolyn, realizing that something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: MADOLYN pulls the headphone jack out of the stereo and roughly the following booms out of the speakers. [NOTE: T

dialogues.text: Your guys shouldn't have done that.

dialogues.text: One of us was going to have to die. It tends to be the other guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN stares at her and we ought to think murder is a possibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm now in charge of everything here. Including Queenan's informers. Theoretically. I can't unlock the files until after the brass squeezes Dignam. If the brass squeezes Dignam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Dignam's the only one with the keys to the kingdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fucking resigning. He put his papers in. He's not talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me his location. Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN and MADOLYN stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was the liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes into the bedroom. COLIN'S PHONE RINGS. He answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY is walking, on the phone, happy, and twisting the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Costello recorded everything. He put all the tapes in a little box and kept them with his lawyer. That was his insurance. His lawyer came to me. Costello trusted me the most. Imagine that you rat fuck. Sound quality good enough? I was a little worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want my identity, you two-faced rat prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three o'clock. Where Queenan died. You keep your cell on.

dialogues.text: COLIN goes to the bedroom door and tries it. Locked. He knocks. No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we not talk about this?   This is my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over. He starts to punch the door, and then does not

dialogues.text: COLIN looks out through the door, no gun drawn, but very a cop clearing his corners. He steps out and--BILLY takes from behind the door, his only blind side, and grabs the of his collar and crams a pistol into the bottom of his skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your hands up.   Hands.   Hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the fuckin' gun down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY turns Colin around and puts the pistol to Colin's forehead, hard enough to break the skin. He takes out Col belt gun and puts it in his pocket. (Billy screams "hands at Colin every time he makes a move).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came here to talk some fucking sense to you. You get a hold of yourself and put down the fuckin' firearm and act professional and I can get you your money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning him around) What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get you your...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY cracks him across the jaw with the gun. COLIN goes down. COLIN is drooling blood, his bell rung, one eye ope Billy throws away Colin's ankle gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spitting teeth) Fuck, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going for Colin's cuffs) You didn't come here to talk, you fuckin' maggot, you came here to get arrested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrested? Arrested for what. (as BILLY cuffs him) So you got tapes of what? Costello was my informant. I was his rat? Fuck you. Prove it. I say he was my informant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up and shut your fuckin' mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, a citizen's arrest? Blow me, prick. Only one of us is a cop, here, Bill. Nobody knows who you are. Nobody knows who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a sergeant in the Mass. State Police. Who the fuck are you? Nobody. I ERASED YOU.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY puts the gun to Colin's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You erased me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Shoot a cop, Einstein. See what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would happen is the bullet would go right through your fuckin' head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you think you're gonna get the parade? The bagpipes and bullshit? Fuck you. (safeties the gun) I'm arresting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the stupidest thing you could do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, shut up, shut the fuck up. (hits him) I don't give a fuck if these charges don't stick. (whaling him in the beats) But I'm still fucking arresting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You are what you do.] Get up. (COLIN doesn't move.) I said get the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY grabs the back of Colin's collar and puts the gun t Colin's head. A crunch of gravel, off. BILLY and COLIN bo hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put down the weapon and step away from Sergeant Sullivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY drags COLIN to his feet and using Colin as a shield aims the pistol at: BROWN. Brown is aiming his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called you. You specifically. You know who I am. I'm not gonna shoot. I told you to meet me downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy realizes he's in a truly shitty situation:   appear are everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the weapon on the deck and step away from Sergeant Sullivan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a mess, bloody-mouthed) Shoot the fuckin' prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperqte) Where's Dignam? I told you to bring Dignam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot the motherfucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the weapon on the ground and we'll discuss it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was Costello's rat. I got evidence. Tapes. Other documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you do, but right now I need you to drop the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I've got the evidence cold linking this prick to Costello... (BROWN wavers) You fuckin' know who I am. I'm taking him downstairs now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BROWN, weapon ready, follows into the elevator lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY moves COLIN into the elevator and as the doors clos looks back at BROWN, still in a Mexican stand-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN, nose broken, blood masking his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait for you to try to explain this to a Suffolk County grand jury. This is gonna be fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The indicator ticks. Down, down, down. Colin sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fucking kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am killing you.

dialogues.text: The doors open and for a frozen moment BILLY, holding the on COLIN, stares out of the car. A LOUD BANG. BILLY is sh through the head. BLOOD sprays the walls, and COLIN is hi flying blood and matter. BILLY falls, crumpled, on his fa half in and half out of the elevator. The doors try to close...open...COLIN, covered with blood, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARRIGAN lowers his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN slumps, covered with blood. BARRIGAN uncuffs him. C feels his wrists. BARRIGAN picks up BILLY'S gun. The othe elevator doors open and BROWN emerges. He looks into the bloody elevator and down at the dead man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holstering his gun) Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARRIGAN raises BILLY'S GUN and shoots BROWN in the head. COLIN stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you think you were the only one he had? Costello was going to sell us to the FBI. It's you and me now. We have to take care of each other. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Give me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARRIGAN casually hands COLIN BILLY'S GUN. COLIN presses gun against BARRIGAN's forehead and fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE TAPE, plenty of cars. Three corpses being loaded o ambulances. COLIN, hands free, is drinking coffee from a paper cup, being checked out by a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN has been cleaned up a little by paramedics. He's ma had his lip stitched, but he's still wearing his bloody clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that time, Trooper Barrigan, who I now understand to have been Francis Costello's informer in SIU, intercepted us in the lobby and shot Trooper William Costigan once in the head. (drinks water) At that time Barrigan retrieved Trooper Costigan's undercover weapon and shot Trooper Brown as he was approaching our location. I attempted to subdue Trooper Barrigan and in the ensuing struggle was struck several times with the Walther pistol. I was able to wrestle the weapon away, at which time Barrigan drew his own weapon and took aim at me. I was able to get off a single shot, striking Barrigan in the head. I then checked for vital signs of Troopers Brown and Costigan and discovered that they had expired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN looks up, eyes clear, perfectly believable.   As we transition to the FUNERAL...bagpipes coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to go on record that I am recommending Trooper William Costigan for the Medal of Merit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAGPIPES (Something like"Cross of Fire") as we DISSOLVE T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILLY'S GRAVESITE. The same cemetery as his mother is bur in. UNIFORMED POLICEMEN (not only State, but MDC, the way they do it, for "brother officers"), saluting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MADOLYN is at the gravesite, dry-eyed though in, distinct apart from COLIN. He looks at her. She looks away from hi apparently forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN squares off: his job in the world is to get ahead. salute is fired with rifles. But later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN and MADOLYN are walking through the graves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves away from him without answering. MADOLYN walks through the cemetery gates. COLIN hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN has a bag of expensive groceries and wine. Living t Beacon Hill dream. He climbs the steps slowly. He nods to neighbor, an old lady coming down with her dog (who incidentally will never accept him as a neighbor, and COL briefly seems aware of this). (Don't be afraid to get a b French here). He gets to his door, and starts to cry, and nearly crumples. But he gets the door open. He looks up a sees a gun. Behind it, stepping fast out of the shadows, DIGNAM. Avenging a guy he didn't even like, because it's right thing to do. COLIN looks down and sees that Dignam plastic hospital boots on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (accepting it, sort of, but only in a COLIN way) OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIGNAM fires. Flash groceries fall all over the floor. DIGNAM'S FEET step over COLIN's body, crushing one of a h dozen croissants, and DIGNAM goes down the expensive staircase, leaving the door to the apartment open. The strangest thing happens: a rat emerges and begins to eat dead man's croissants. The rat hears something and runs s it's not in the shot when it
